Instruction: Mix yeast with warm water in a large mixing bowl. Add buttermilk, eggs, 2 1/2 cups flour, 1/2 cup margarine, 1/2 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt. Blend on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping sides and bottom of the bowl. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes. Stir in the remaining 3 cups of flour (dough should be soft and slightly sticky). Knead for 5 minutes, about 200 turns on a lightly floured board. Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes.

Cut the dough in half and shape each piece into a 12x7 inch rectangle. Spread 1 tablespoon of softened butter on each half, then sprinkle with 1/4 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. Roll up each half, starting from the wider side, and seal by pinching the seams. Slice each roll into 12 pieces.

Prepare two 9-inch round cake pans by coating each with 1/4 cup melted butter, 1/4 cup brown sugar, and 1/2 cup chopped pecans. Arrange 12 dough slices in each pan, leaving some space between them. Allow dough to rise until doubled in size.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius).
Bake the buns in the oven that has been preheated for 30 minutes. Invert the pans onto serving plates right away.
